Class MenuBuilder

Object
MenuBuilder
public final class MenuBuilder extends Object
A class with method chaining operations for creating consistent command-line interface (CLI) menus. Example usage: int choice = MenuBuilder.create() .setHeader("System Dashboard") .setOptions("View Users", "Edit Settings") .setFooter("Exit") .render();

  • Method Details

    • create

      public static MenuBuilder create()
      Creates a new MenuBuilder instance.
      Returns:
      A new MenuBuilder object for fluent configuration

    • setHeader

      public MenuBuilder setHeader(String... headerLines)
      Sets the header text for the menu, centered automatically.
      Parameters:
      headerLines - One or more lines of header text
      Returns:
      The current MenuBuilder instance for method chaining

    • setOptions

      public MenuBuilder setOptions(String... options)
      Sets the menu options to be displayed as a numbered list.
      Parameters:
      options - Array of option descriptions
      Returns:
      The current MenuBuilder instance for method chaining

    • setFooter

      public MenuBuilder setFooter(String footer)
      Sets the footer option displayed as option 0, for consistency.
      Parameters:
      footer - The description for the exit/logout option
      Returns:
      The current MenuBuilder instance for method chaining

    • setPrompt

      public MenuBuilder setPrompt(String prompt)
      Sets a custom input prompt for the menu. Optional.
      Parameters:
      prompt - The prompt text to display before waiting for input
      Returns:
      The current MenuBuilder instance for method chaining

    • setWidth

      public MenuBuilder setWidth(int width)
      Sets the width of the menu in characters. Optional.
      Parameters:
      width - The total width of the menu (default: 40)
      Returns:
      The current MenuBuilder instance for method chaining

    • render

      public int render()
      Renders the configured menu and captures user menu input.
      Returns:
      The user's selected option as an integer. Returns 0 for footer option, 1-N for menu options

    • isSectionHeader

      private boolean isSectionHeader(String item)
      Determines if a menu item represents a section header based on formatting. Section headers are identified by "#" at the start.
      Parameters:
      item - The menu item text to check
      Returns:
      true if the item is formatted as a section header, false otherwise

    • handleSectionHeader

      private void handleSectionHeader(String header)
      Process and displays a section header.
      Parameters:
      header - The raw header text starting with "#"

    • printHorizontalLine

      private void printHorizontalLine()
      Helper function to print a horizontal line using dashes.

    • printCentered

      private void printCentered(String text)
      Helper function to print text centered within the menu width.
      Parameters:
      text - The text to center-align
